channel.title: Comments for page "Sabotage Facility"
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Sabotage Facility"

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
A. A village with a Sabotage Facility can bingo people normally, but cannot Hard Bingo a non-Sabofac village.
B. As above, a village with a Sabotage Facility can attack villages normally, with no target limitation.
C. Now, this is where i'd like confirmation as I've not played around with it myself, but my understanding is that the -basic- Sabotage (the few hundred/thousand points of damage) that we had prior to the change can still be done on an attack. It is a for sure, however, that you cannot Declare All-Out War on a non-Sabofac village, so none of the real forms of attack are available against a non-Sabofac village.
D. Most of the time, wars are pointless and never done. It's better over all to just to have it, so you have the wider bingo and attack options.

If your village has no SB, can a village with SB:
1. Bingo your people?
2. Attack your village?
3. Sabotage your buildings?

its clear that YOU cannot attack a village with SB, but not if the reverse is possible.

item.content:encoded: You can't rebuild it for a week (7 days), and you cannot Hard-Bingo at all, as well as invade or bingo (in) villages with a Sabo Facility, though you can still spy on them.
